channel.title: anti-Leach
channel.description: Im kinda new to this forum and stuff, so i was wondering, what exactly is leaching? and how do you make sumthing anti leach?

item.title: anti-Leach
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

Oh i c, and im ok wit java so those little errors dont mess wit me

Read full topic

item.title: anti-Leach
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

First off it’s spelled ‘leeching’. And it is when someone new to the forums (Like yourself) doesn’t bother to learn how to do anything, so they just go to the tutorial section and add tutorials to their “server”. It wouldn’t be so bad, except that when they do it incorrectly they bother everyone with thier moronically simple errors. Making something anti-leech is intentionally adding a small imperfection (Such as a missing comma or semicolon) that anyone with half a brain could easily fix while they install the code, but that some leech can’t figure out for the life of them what the compiler is saying when “line 45239: ‘;’ expected public void antileech(){ return }”. When someone explicitly puts the words anti-leech at the top of the tutorial, it is basically saying “If you don’t understand how to fix this small intentionally added error, then you are a retard who should fuck off and learn Java already.”

I like this explanation.

Read full topic
